flawed_nl_solution:
The cost of her rent and utilities was 2/5*p = 2p/5
Her income was increased by $600 so it is now p+$600
The cost of her rent and utilities now amount to 1/4*(p+$600) = (p+$600)/4
Equating both expressions for cost of rent and utilities: 2p/5 = (p+$600)/4
Multiplying both sides of the equation by 20 gives 8p = 5p+${ERROR}
Subtracting 5p from both sides gives: 3p = ${ERROR}
Dividing both sides by 3 gives p = $10000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1000.0, not 10000.0. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
